page.title: 02BARLOW GRANGE FARM
page.content: The house was built about{1843.}The farm was there before the house and is {260 acres.}They grow apples, pears and plums in the orchard. They breed cattle{(British White, Highland}and {Black Belt)}and horses. One of the horses was born on Jubilee day. So they call it Jubilee. It has a 'J' on its forehead. The other two horses are called Erica and Coachman. The farm grows crops of oats, barley, wheat and oil seed rape which is used for marga- rine. The farmer gets up at 6.30am. There is a{well}which was built in {1888}and is 7m deep. There are gold- fish ponds in the garden. In the back there is an{anemometer.}The house has 5 bedroms, 2 bathrooms and 2 kitchens. They have 4 dogs. In 1917 soldiers from Italy and Germany worked as farm labourers. The farmer,{Mr. Richardson, has been living there since 1949.
